intro: Amsinckia canescens, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
